00039 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00040   Linker generated Symbols
00041  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 extern uint32_t __etext;
00043 extern uint32_t __data_start__;
00044 extern uint32_t __data_end__;
00045 extern uint32_t __copy_table_start__;
00046 extern uint32_t __copy_table_end__;
00047 extern uint32_t __zero_table_start__;
00048 extern uint32_t __zero_table_end__;
00049 extern uint32_t __bss_start__;
00050 extern uint32_t __bss_end__;
00051 extern uint32_t __StackTop;
00052 
00053 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054   Exception / Interrupt Handler Function Prototype
00055  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00056 typedef void( *pFunc )( void );
00057 
00058 
00059 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00060   External References
00061  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00062 #ifndef __START
00063 extern void  _start(void) __attribute__((noreturn));    /* Pre Main (C library entry point) */
00064 #else
00065 extern int  __START(void) __attribute__((noreturn));    /* main entry point */
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 #ifndef __NO_SYSTEM_INIT
00069 extern void SystemInit (void);            /* CMSIS System Initialization      */
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 
00073 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074   Internal References
00075  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00076 void Default_Handler(void);                          /* Default empty handler */
00077 void Reset_Handler(void);                            /* Reset Handler */

00080 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081   User Initial Stack & Heap
00082  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00083 #ifndef __STACK_SIZE
00084 #define __STACK_SIZE  0x00000400
00085 #endif
00086 static uint8_t stack[__STACK_SIZE] __attribute__ ((aligned(8), used, section(".stack")));
00087 
00088 #ifndef __HEAP_SIZE
00089 #define __HEAP_SIZE   0x00000C00
00090 #endif
00091 #if __HEAP_SIZE > 0
00092 static uint8_t heap[__HEAP_SIZE]   __attribute__ ((aligned(8), used, section(".heap")));
00093 #endif

00096 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00097   Exception / Interrupt Handler
00098  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00099 /* Cortex-M Processor Exceptions */
00100 void NMI_Handler         (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00101 void HardFault_Handler   (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00102 void MemManage_Handler   (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00103 void BusFault_Handler    (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00104 void UsageFault_Handler  (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00105 void DebugMon_Handler    (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00106 void SVC_Handler         (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00107 void PendSV_Handler      (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00108 void SysTick_Handler     (void) __attribute__ ((weak, alias("Default_Handler")));
00109

00144 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00145   Exception / Interrupt Vector table
00146  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00147 const pFunc __Vectors[] __attribute__ ((section(".vectors"))) = {
00148   /* Cortex-M Exception Handlers */
00149   (pFunc)&__StackTop,                       /*      Initial Stack Pointer     */
00150   Reset_Handler,                            /*      Reset Handler             */
00151   NMI_Handler,                              /*      NMI Handler               */
00152   HardFault_Handler,                        /*      Hard Fault Handler        */
00153   MemManage_Handler,                        /*      MPU Fault Handler         */
00154   BusFault_Handler,                         /*      Bus Fault Handler         */
00155   UsageFault_Handler,                       /*      Usage Fault Handler       */
00156   Default_Handler,                          /*      Reserved                  */
00157   Default_Handler,                          /*      Reserved                  */
00158   Default_Handler,                          /*      Reserved                  */
00159   Default_Handler,                          /*      Reserved                  */
00160   SVC_Handler,                              /*      SVCall Handler            */
00161   DebugMon_Handler,                         /*      Debug Monitor Handler     */
00162   Default_Handler,                          /*      Reserved                  */
00163   PendSV_Handler,                           /*      PendSV Handler            */
00164   SysTick_Handler,                          /*      SysTick Handler           */
00165 
00166   /* External interrupts */
00167 
00168   DMA_IRQHandler,                       /*  0 - DMA       */
00169   GPIO_EVEN_IRQHandler,                       /*  1 - GPIO_EVEN       */
00170   TIMER0_IRQHandler,                       /*  2 - TIMER0       */
00171   USART0_RX_IRQHandler,                       /*  3 - USART0_RX       */
00172   USART0_TX_IRQHandler,                       /*  4 - USART0_TX       */
00173   ACMP0_IRQHandler,                       /*  5 - ACMP0       */
00174   ADC0_IRQHandler,                       /*  6 - ADC0       */
00175   DAC0_IRQHandler,                       /*  7 - DAC0       */
00176   I2C0_IRQHandler,                       /*  8 - I2C0       */
00177   GPIO_ODD_IRQHandler,                       /*  9 - GPIO_ODD       */
00178   TIMER1_IRQHandler,                       /*  10 - TIMER1       */
00179   TIMER2_IRQHandler,                       /*  11 - TIMER2       */
00180   USART1_RX_IRQHandler,                       /*  12 - USART1_RX       */
00181   USART1_TX_IRQHandler,                       /*  13 - USART1_TX       */
00182   USART2_RX_IRQHandler,                       /*  14 - USART2_RX       */
00183   USART2_TX_IRQHandler,                       /*  15 - USART2_TX       */
00184   UART0_RX_IRQHandler,                       /*  16 - UART0_RX       */
00185   UART0_TX_IRQHandler,                       /*  17 - UART0_TX       */
00186   LEUART0_IRQHandler,                       /*  18 - LEUART0       */
00187   LEUART1_IRQHandler,                       /*  19 - LEUART1       */
00188   LETIMER0_IRQHandler,                       /*  20 - LETIMER0       */
00189   PCNT0_IRQHandler,                       /*  21 - PCNT0       */
00190   PCNT1_IRQHandler,                       /*  22 - PCNT1       */
00191   PCNT2_IRQHandler,                       /*  23 - PCNT2       */
00192   RTC_IRQHandler,                       /*  24 - RTC       */
00193   CMU_IRQHandler,                       /*  25 - CMU       */
00194   VCMP_IRQHandler,                       /*  26 - VCMP       */
00195   LCD_IRQHandler,                       /*  27 - LCD       */
00196   MSC_IRQHandler,                       /*  28 - MSC       */
00197   AES_IRQHandler,                       /*  29 - AES       */
00198   Default_Handler,                          /*  30 - Reserved      */
00199 
00200 };

00203 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00204   Reset Handler called on controller reset
00205  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00206 void Reset_Handler(void) {
00207   uint32_t *pSrc, *pDest;
00208   uint32_t *pTable __attribute__((unused));
00209 
00210 #ifndef __NO_SYSTEM_INIT
00211   SystemInit();
00212 #endif
00213 
00214 /*  Firstly it copies data from read only memory to RAM. There are two schemes
00215  *  to copy. One can copy more than one sections. Another can only copy
00216  *  one section.  The former scheme needs more instructions and read-only
00217  *  data to implement than the latter.
00218  *  Macro __STARTUP_COPY_MULTIPLE is used to choose between two schemes.  */
00219 
00220 #ifdef __STARTUP_COPY_MULTIPLE
00221 /*  Multiple sections scheme.
00222  *
00223  *  Between symbol address __copy_table_start__ and __copy_table_end__,
00224  *  there are array of triplets, each of which specify:
00225  *    offset 0: LMA of start of a section to copy from
00226  *    offset 4: VMA of start of a section to copy to
00227  *    offset 8: size of the section to copy. Must be multiply of 4
00228  *
00229  *  All addresses must be aligned to 4 bytes boundary.
00230  */
00231   pTable = &__copy_table_start__;
00232 
00233   for (; pTable < &__copy_table_end__; pTable = pTable + 3)
00234   {
00235     pSrc  = (uint32_t*)*(pTable + 0);
00236     pDest = (uint32_t*)*(pTable + 1);
00237     for (; pDest < (uint32_t*)(*(pTable + 1) + *(pTable + 2)) ; )
00238     {
00239       *pDest++ = *pSrc++;
00240     }
00241   }
00242 #else
00243 /*  Single section scheme.
00244  *
00245  *  The ranges of copy from/to are specified by following symbols
00246  *    __etext: LMA of start of the section to copy from. Usually end of text
00247  *    __data_start__: VMA of start of the section to copy to
00248  *    __data_end__: VMA of end of the section to copy to
00249  *
00250  *  All addresses must be aligned to 4 bytes boundary.
00251  */
00252   pSrc  = &__etext;
00253   pDest = &__data_start__;
00254 
00255   for ( ; pDest < &__data_end__ ; )
00256   {
00257     *pDest++ = *pSrc++;
00258   }
00259 #endif /*__STARTUP_COPY_MULTIPLE */
00260 
00261 /*  This part of work usually is done in C library startup code. Otherwise,
00262  *  define this macro to enable it in this startup.
00263  *
00264  *  There are two schemes too. One can clear multiple BSS sections. Another
00265  *  can only clear one section. The former is more size expensive than the
00266  *  latter.
00267  *
00268  *  Define macro __STARTUP_CLEAR_BSS_MULTIPLE to choose the former.
00269  *  Otherwise efine macro __STARTUP_CLEAR_BSS to choose the later.
00270  */
00271 #ifdef __STARTUP_CLEAR_BSS_MULTIPLE
00272 /*  Multiple sections scheme.
00273  *
00274  *  Between symbol address __copy_table_start__ and __copy_table_end__,
00275  *  there are array of tuples specifying:
00276  *    offset 0: Start of a BSS section
00277  *    offset 4: Size of this BSS section. Must be multiply of 4
00278  */
00279   pTable = &__zero_table_start__;
00280 
00281   for (; pTable < &__zero_table_end__; pTable = pTable + 2)
00282   {
00283     pDest = (uint32_t*)*(pTable + 0);
00284     for (; pDest < (uint32_t*)(*(pTable + 0) + *(pTable + 1)) ; )
00285     {
00286       *pDest++ = 0;
00287     }
00288   }
00289 #elif defined (__STARTUP_CLEAR_BSS)
00290 /*  Single BSS section scheme.
00291  *
00292  *  The BSS section is specified by following symbols
00293  *    __bss_start__: start of the BSS section.
00294  *    __bss_end__: end of the BSS section.
00295  *
00296  *  Both addresses must be aligned to 4 bytes boundary.
00297  */
00298   pDest = &__bss_start__;
00299 
00300   for ( ; pDest < &__bss_end__ ; )
00301   {
00302     *pDest++ = 0ul;
00303   }
00304 #endif /* __STARTUP_CLEAR_BSS_MULTIPLE || __STARTUP_CLEAR_BSS */
00305 
00306 #ifndef __START
00307 #define __START _start
00308 #endif
00309   __START();
00310 }
00311 
00312 
00313 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00314   Default Handler for Exceptions / Interrupts
00315  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00316 void Default_Handler(void)
00317 {
00318   while(1);
00319 }
